org.walkingarchive.backend.controller
Class CardController

java.lang.Object
  org.walkingarchive.backend.controller.CardController

public class CardController
extends java.lang.Object

CardController is responsible for serving information about Magic Cards via rest services. Each method is tagged with the url path to visit (appended to the main url dev.mtgwalkingarchive.com:8080).

Author:
Alison Orlando

CardController

public CardController()
Method Detail

getCardById

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardById(java.lang.String card)
Retrieves a Magic card by its id and returns the card as a JSON object. If no card is found, a 404 status is returned.

Parameters:
card - - an integer representing the card id
Returns:
Magic card represented as a JSON object, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByName

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByName(java.lang.String card)
Retrieves Magic cards by name and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no card is found, an empty array is returned. This method defaults to returning the first 20 results found when searching for the name prefix.

Parameters:
card - - a string representing the card name
Returns:
Magic cards represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByNameOffset

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByNameOffset(java.lang.String card,
                                                      int offset)
Retrieves Magic cards by name and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no card is found, an empty array is returned. Similar to the getCardsByName method, this function allows the caller to specify the offset of results to return.

Parameters:
card - - a string representing the card name
offset - - an integer representing the 'page' of results to retrieve. The default is 1, which returns the first 20 results.
Returns:
Magic cards represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByType

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByType(java.lang.String type)
Retrieves Magic cards by type and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. This method defaults to returning the first 20 results found when searching for the name prefix.

Parameters:
type - - a string representing the type of a Magic card (i.e. 'enchantment')
Returns:
Magic cards of the given type represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByTypeOffset

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByTypeOffset(java.lang.String type,
                                                      int offset)
Retrieves Magic cards by type and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. Similar to the getCardsByType method, this function allows the caller to specify the offset of results to return.

Parameters:
type - - a string representing the type of a Magic card (i.e. 'enchantment')
offset - - an integer representing the 'page' of results to retrieve. The default is 1, which returns the first 20 results
Returns:
Magic cards of the given type represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsBySet

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsBySet(int setId)
Retrieves Magic cards by set and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned.

Parameters:
setId - - an integer representing the set id of a Magic card
Returns:
Magic cards of the given set represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsBySet

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsBySet(java.lang.String setname)
Retrieves Magic cards by set name and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned.

Parameters:
setname - - a string representing the name of a set of a Magic card
Returns:
Magic cards of the given set represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByMana

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByMana(java.lang.String mana)
Retrieves Magic cards by mana color and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. This method defaults to returning the first 20 results found when searching for the name prefix.

Parameters:
mana - - a string representing the mana color of a Magic card (i.e. 'red')
Returns:
Magic cards of the given mana color represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByManaOffset

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByManaOffset(java.lang.String mana,
                                                      int offset)
Retrieves Magic cards by mana color and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. Similar to the getCardsByMana method, this function allows the caller to specify the offset of results to return.

Parameters:
mana - - a string representing the mana color of a Magic card (i.e. 'red')
offset - - an integer representing the 'page' of results to retrieve. The default is 1, which will return the first 20 results.
Returns:
Magic cards of the given mana color represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByNameManaType

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByNameManaType(java.lang.String name,
                                                        java.lang.String type,
                                                        java.lang.String mana)
Retrieves Magic cards by a combination of name, type, and mana color and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. This method defaults to returning the first 20 results found when searching for the name prefix.

Parameters:
name - - a string representing the name of a Magic card, accepts prefix form
type - - a string representing the type of a Magic card (i.e. 'enchantment')
mana - - a srting representing the mana of a Magic card (i.e. 'red')
Returns:
Magic cards of the given name, type, and mana color represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByNameManaTypeOffset

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByNameManaTypeOffset(java.lang.String name,
                                                              java.lang.String type,
                                                              java.lang.String mana,
                                                              int offset)
Retrieves Magic cards by a combination of name, type, and mana color and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. Similar to the getCardsByNameManaType method, this function allows the caller to specify the offset of results to return.

Parameters:
name - - a string representing the name of a Magic card, accepts prefix form
type - - a string representing the type of a Magic card (i.e. 'enchantment')
mana - - a srting representing the mana of a Magic card (i.e. 'red')
offset - - an integer representing the 'page' of results to retrieve. The default is 1, which will return the first 20 results.
Returns:
Magic cards of the given name, type, and mana color represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByManaType

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByManaType(java.lang.String type,
                                                    java.lang.String mana)
Retrieves Magic cards by a combination of type and mana color and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. By default, this method returns a maximum of 20 results.

Parameters:
type - - a string representing the type of a Magic card (i.e. 'enchantment')
mana - - a srting representing the mana of a Magic card (i.e. 'red')
Returns:
Magic cards of the given type and mana color represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByManaTypeOffset

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByManaTypeOffset(java.lang.String type,
                                                          java.lang.String mana,
                                                          int offset)
Retrieves Magic cards by a combination of type and mana color and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. Similar to the getCardsByeManaType method, this function allows the caller to specify the offset of results to return.

Parameters:
type - - a string representing the type of a Magic card (i.e. 'enchantment')
mana - - a srting representing the mana of a Magic card (i.e. 'red')
offset - - an integer representing the 'page' of results to retrieve. The default is 1, which will return the first 20 results.
Returns:
Magic cards of the given type and mana color represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByNameMana

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByNameMana(java.lang.String name,
                                                    java.lang.String mana)
Retrieves Magic cards by a combination of name and mana color and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. By default, this method returns the first 20 results.

Parameters:
name - - a string representing the name of a Magic card, accepts prefix form
mana - - a srting representing the mana of a Magic card (i.e. 'red')
Returns:
Magic cards of the given name and mana color represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByNameManaOffset(java.lang.String name,
                                                          java.lang.String mana,
                                                          int offset)
Retrieves Magic cards by a combination of name and mana color and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. Similar to the getCardsByNameMana method, this function allows the caller to specify the offset of results to return.

Parameters:
name - - a string representing the name of a Magic card, accepts prefix form
mana - - a srting representing the mana of a Magic card (i.e. 'red')
offset - - an integer representing the 'page' of results to retrieve. The default is 1, which will return the first 20 results.
Returns:
Magic cards of the given name and mana color represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByNameType

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByNameType(java.lang.String name,
                                                    java.lang.String type)
Retrieves Magic cards by a combination of name and type and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. By default, this method returns the first 20 results.

Parameters:
name - - a string representing the name of a Magic card, accepts prefix form
type - - a string representing the type of a Magic card (i.e. 'enchantment')
Returns:
Magic cards of the given name and type represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByNameTypeOffset

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getCardsByNameTypeOffset(java.lang.String name,
                                                          java.lang.String type,
                                                          int offset)
Retrieves Magic cards by a combination of name and type and returns the cards as a JSON array. If no cards are found, an empty array is returned. Similar to the getCardsByNameType method, this function allows the caller to specify the offset of results to return.

Parameters:
name - - a string representing the name of a Magic card, accepts prefix form
type - - a string representing the type of a Magic card (i.e. 'enchantment')
offset - - an integer representing the 'page' of results to retrieve. The default is 1, which will return the first 20 results.
Returns:
Magic cards of the given name and type represented as a JSON array, or Status 404 if not found.

getCardsByTextSearch

public java.util.List<Card> getCardsByTextSearch(java.lang.String query)
Retrieves Magic cards by running the search engine query on the passed in string. This method retrieves the first 20 results.

Parameters:
query - - a String representing the words on a Magic card
Returns:
Magic cards that match terms in the query, weighted by relevance, or null if none are found
